text: Charles Brantley Aycock was an American Democratic Party politician. He was the governor of North Carolina from 1901 to 1905. While he was governor, a number of reforms were carried outThe North Carolina Democratic hand-book prepared by the State Democratic Executive Committee of North Carolina, 1906 affecting areas such as welfare,The life and speeches of Charles Brantley Aycock, by R. D. W. Connor and Clarence Poe, 1912, P.94 child labor, and education.GOVERNOR CHARLES B. AYCOCK, n.d., 1901-1905Laws and resolutions of the State of North Carolina.
